alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 6:20PM MDT until June 29 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Salt Creek and nearby small stream flooding caused by excessive thunderstorm rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Natrona. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over rural oil field roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 611 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported high flows on Salt Creek and other small streams in the area, due to earlier heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This earlier heavy rain along with continued light rain will continue cause small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen, with light rain continuing this evening. Additional heavy rain due to thunderstorms is not expected at this time. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Salt Creek, Big Bull Cedar Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Bothwell Draw, Bobcat Creek, Coal Draw, Little Bull Cedar Creek, Holmes Draw, Castle Creek, East Teapot Creek, North Cottonwood Creek, Sherwood Creek, McKenzie Draw, Teapot Creek, Jimmies Creek, Sand Spring Creek and Steven L Creek. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Low spots near Hwy 259 south and northwest of Midwest and Edgerton, and roads in the oil fields near Naval Reserve and Teapot Ranch.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service.
